Can you also elaborate the test cases? What was the test cases which you ran for?
=> User lock 
=> Password quality.
=> Minium password length.

I also noticed that you changed the pam configuration files in other commit which may impact other use cases.
So need the complete test case list which we have run against all these commits.

Also I don't see the unit test cases.Can you please add some test cases here to cover the above functionality

s/min/minlen/
Why do we need this condition if we are removing the pam_tally and pam_cracklib?

This code still handles the common-password pam_history.so remember= parameter which is exposed by Redfish AccountService.RememberOldPasswordTimes.  So I left this code in.  See the commit message for the test case.
same as above.
same
Can we add some comment here? How the output looks like for the error?

I'll add a comment that says the error message is: /usr/sbin/faillock: Error clearing the tally file for {user}:{output from perror}

The next line handles this error case.  I unit tested this path by messing with the tally file (I don't remember exactly how).

The steps to test this (where '#' is the shell prompt for the root user) are:
Change the faillock directory to a plain file:
# mv /var/run/faillock /var/run/faillock-real
# touch /var/run/faillock

# faillock
faillock: Error reading tally directory: Not a directory
# busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.User.Manager /xyz/openbmc_project/user/admin
Failed to get all properties on interface
  xyz.openbmc_project.User.Attributes: The operation failed internally.

Then to recover:
# rm /var/run/faillock
# mv /var/run/faillock-real /var/run/faillock
typo?
typo?  Yes, my fat fingers.  I will s/onlt/only/.

what are the tests which we ran? Can we specify here?
I think you had it somewhere else
Sorry, I had detailed all of the test cases in https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/41357.  I'll repeat them here.
more verbose output during clean?

The change on this line is required to pass CI.  It requires use of `find ... -print0 | xargs -0 ...` (null-terminated filenames) so it can handle filenames which contain strange characters.  Otherwise the effect of this pipeline is the same as before.

Why do you need both find and recursive rm (other than recursive rm handles directories?

Can we let rm do the recursion and just do the proper hide of the filename?
 rm -rf "./${file}"
 
 alternativevly find -depth 1 ...
why the single colon has been replaced with double colon?

The change on this line is required to pass CI.  It complained about using ${} inside the single quoted string because shell variable expansion does not happen inside of single quotes string and it thought the variable wanted to expand.  It didn't.  the output of the echo command is the same as before.

this appears to have the magic disable
https://github.com/koalaman/shellcheck/wiki/SC2016#exceptions
If you were observing a different warning then please add it to the list seperated by a comma
why ? & how we are preserving FW Update scenario.

This commit changes

(Just to make sure this is the commit which changes the implementation)

I believe your intention is to capture user level interfaces which will be using these properties, i think it's better not to call as affected in user level interfaces.

In short - There is no affect to user level interface as the underlying implementation will take care. Can we re-word as, Any User-level interfaces which uses these D-Bus properties (x,y,z) should not see any change in behavior, and few are listed

Shall we put a Fixes subject: 

Fixes: 
list all the fixes (This way it will be easy to convey)
shall we call this as directConfigFile / moduleConfigFile to indicate that this is direct module configuration file, and doesn't require a module name search in the configuration file.
Name change would be better to indicate, why moduleName check is skipped, because in direct configuration file, moduleName search is not needed.

When output.size() < 2, then it means that there is an error, and this property can't return proper value. Earlier, exception will be thrown, which will be captured by sdbusplus code and corresponding error will be exposed to the user.

This value will be treated as property return value.

Need to always return userLockedForFailedAttempt(userName)  (In case of error userLockedForFailedAttempt will return the correct value.
Added some notes.
Please identify spellcheck issues by name if addressing
@joseph: Do we still need this MR?

This code is incorrect.  This leg should `return true`.
The error checking for output.size()<2 should be performed prinr to this test.

If this bug is not fixed, then when any user is LockedForFailedAttempt, then this code will cause an error which causes phosphor-user-manager to stop working.
